derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English mōr, of Germanic origin
late 15th cent.: probably from the Germanic base of Dutch meren

entry.tran: (主要生长杂草和石南的)高原贫瘠之地，荒野，旷野
entry.def: A moor is an area of open and usually high land with poor soil that is covered mainly with grass and heather.

example.ex: Colliford is higher, right up on the moors...
example.tran: 科利福德位置更高，就在荒野之上。

example.ex: Exmoor National Park stretches over 265 square miles of moor.
example.tran: 埃克斯穆尔高地国家公园位于高原贫瘠之地，占地265平方英里。

entry.def: If you moor a boat somewhere, you stop and tie it to the land with a rope or chain so that it cannot move away.

example.ex: She had moored her barge on the right bank of the river...
example.tran: 她把驳船停泊在河右岸。

example.ex: I decided to moor near some tourist boats.
example.tran: 我决定在一些观光船附近停泊。

entry.tran: 摩尔人(公元8至15世纪在北非和西班牙建立文明，信奉伊斯兰教)
entry.def: The Moors were a Muslim people who established a civilization in North Africa and Spain between the 8th and the 15th century A.D.

means.word_mean: 1. open land usually with peaty soil covered with heather and bracken and moss
1. secure in or as if in a berth or dock;
2. come into or dock at a wharf;
